meanings.definition: A proclitic is a type of clitic that attaches to the beginning of a word.
meanings.sent1: In linguistics, a proclitic is a small word that sticks to the start of another word.
meanings.sent2: Many languages use proclitics to join words together at the start.
meanings.sent3: The proclitic was so eager to attach itself to the word that it jumped on quickly!
meanings.sent4: Like a tiny hitchhiker, the proclitic latched onto the word for the ride.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the proclitic as a tiny magnet pulling words together at the beginning.

meanings.definition: Proclitics are commonly found in various languages, including English and Greek.
meanings.sent1: English and Greek both have proclitics that link words at the start.
meanings.sent2: Linguists study how proclitics in different languages work together.
meanings.sent3: The proclitics in English and Greek had a friendly chat about their favorite words.
meanings.sent4: In the language world, proclitics are like the connectors that bridge words together.
meanings.sent5: The diversity of proclitics across languages showcases the beauty of linguistic connections.
